alert.note: Alert for Lee (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued February 17 at 1:06AM EST until February 19 at 7:00PM EST by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 915 AM EST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Portions of east central Kentucky, south central Kentucky and southeast Kentucky, including the following counties, in east central Kentucky, Estill, Menifee and Powell. In south central Kentucky, Rockcastle. In southeast Kentucky, Breathitt, Clay, Jackson, Lee, Magoffin, Morgan, Owsley and Wolfe. * WHEN...Until 915 AM EST Friday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Dangerous flows over low-water crossings. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 105 AM EST, Doppler radar indicated moderate to heavy rain falling from showers. Minor flooding is ongoing in the advisory area. Between 3 and 4.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... West Liberty, Irvine, Mount Vernon, Jackson, Beattyville, McKee, Campton, Booneville, Boone, Simpson, Henry, Lewis, Fincastle, Ravenna, Mount Olive, Proctor, White Ash, Belle Point, Corgleton and Maloney.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
